content: cochineal design and photos by anna mäkilä fb katse kantapäihin instagram @katse_kantapaihin due to covid-19 we were not able to go on holiday abroad so i started to recall our previous trips and to design my sock series needles in my backpack the first destination is peru one of our unforgettable tours in peru was to the sacred valley of the incas there we had an opportunity to see the traditional natural dyeing methods the most impressive of which was dyeing of red colours red was always an especially important colour to the andean people traditionally the element used to produce red dye in the andes is cochineal an insect that inhabits tuna cactus plants throughout peru cochineal is ph sensitive that means that the colour varies when different people dye with cochineal insects my daughter and i have produced completely different shades of red note that the cochineal pattern has individual instructions for the right and left socks with mirrored charts knit charts a1 and c1 for the one sock charts a2 and c2 for the other one 1 you need fingering-weight sock yarn sample was knit in malabrigo sock 100 % merino 402 m / 100 g main color mc 45 g of malabrigo sock 100 % merino 402 m / 100 g colorway baco contrast color cc 35 g of malabrigo sock 100 % merino 402 m / 100 g colorway ravelry red needles 2 00 and 2 25 mm or size needed to obtain correct gauge tapestry needle and 2 stitch markers optional the pattern is written for 2 circular needles but you can use dpns or magic loop as well gauge 32 sts and 44 rnds = 10 cm 4 inches in stockinette with smaller needles and in color work with larger needles sizes s foot circumference 20 cm/7 25 inches m foot circumference 22 5 cm/8 75 inches l foot circumference 25 cm/9 5 inches abbreviations mc - main color cc contrast color k knit k tbl knit through the back loop k2tog - knit 2 sts together m1 left leaning with left needle lift strand between stitches from front to back and knit it through the back m1 right leaning with left needle lift strand between stitches from back to front and knit it p purl p2tog - purl 2 sts together round s round s rs right side ssk my way slip 1 st knitwise yarn behind pass it back to left needle knit both sts together through the back loop st s stitch es ws wrong side * - * repeat leg with cc and smaller needles cast on 63/72/81 sts divide stitches as evenly as possible over both needles and join to begin working in the round the beginning of the round will be at the back of the foot start ribbing *p1 k1tbl p1* work ribbing for 16 rounds or until the cuff measures the desired length in the last round work sizes s and l at the end
